alert.note: Alert for Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:39AM EST until January 10 at 2:23PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Rowan County in Piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 AM EST, High water conditions continue across Rowan County early this morning due to runoff from the recent heavy rainfall. Continued flooding is likely through the early morning hours along Grants Creek and North Second Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salisbury, China Grove, Spencer, Landis, Cooleemee, Cleveland, Piedmont Research Station, Woodleaf and Mount Ulla. - Flooding is most likely along North Second Creek above Statesville Boulevard south of Woodleaf. Floodwaters may impact White Road, Lyerly Road, Upright Road, Graham Road, Hall Road, Childers Road, and Bear Poplar Road. Flooding along Grants Creek may impact Rowan Mill Road west of Salisbury. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
